learning_objectives.description: Represent and interpret inequalities, including on a number line.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: When representing and interpreting inequalities on a number line: open circles should be used to represent strict inequalities (<, >), closed circles should be used to represent inclusive inequalities (≤, ≥). e.g. -3 ≤ x < 1.

learning_objectives.description: Construct, solve and interpret linear inequalities.
Represent and interpret linear inequalities in two variables graphically.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: The following conventions should be used: broken lines should be used to represent strict inequalities (<, >), solid lines should be used to represent inclusive inequalities (≤, ≥), shading should be used to represent unwanted regions (unless otherwise directed in the question).

learning_objectives.description: List inequalities that define a given region.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Linear programming problems are not included.
